title: 'Marvelous Land of Oz': Windsor-like Serif
content:
From a magazine from the 70s. Thanks in advance!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |

author: Brown Fox

comments.content:
Hi Brown Fox,  
it seems you havenâ€™t attached an image ( [How to post a sample or image](http://web.archive.org/web/20100120091742/http:/typophile.com/node/18067)).  
Cheers,  
F
Ooh, I think I used to have this book. Wonderful stuff. I'd be surprised if this wasn't hand lettered. The serifs on the letters are all different, and the two /a/s and two /e/s are different widths.
What Ben said. Probably not a font.
That style reminds me of the old wordmark of the Tarzan's comics and of other pulps.

You should check Nick Curtis's work. He has frequently digitized things from earlier times.

- Mike Yanega
